DataElement.preferredName: RT Beam Control Point Quantity Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of control points in Beam.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Beam Control Point Quantity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._Any one of a set of linear accelerator parameters that define the segments from which a radiation beam is applied._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any one of a set of linear accelerator parameters that define the segments from which a radiation beam is applied.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.definition: Any one of a set of linear accelerator parameters that define the segments from which a radiation beam is applied.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  12/11/13 created for a Norton CC DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: IS: A string of characters representing an Integer in base-10 (decimal), shall contain only the listed characters (0-9, +,-). [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::12:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/9/13 changed data type to number for reuse in CRF Standard. jc  1/6/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6
